1: <sup>1</sup> Out of the depths have I cried unto thee, O LORD.
2: <sup>2</sup> Lord, hear my voice: let thine ears be attentive to the voice of my supplications.
3: <sup>3</sup> If thou, LORD, shouldest mark iniquities, O Lord, who shall stand?
4: <sup>4</sup> But there is forgiveness with thee, that thou mayest be feared.
5: <sup>5</sup> I wait for the LORD, my soul doth wait, and in his word do I hope.
6: <sup>6</sup> My soul waiteth for the Lord more than they that watch for the morning: I say, more than they that watch for the morning.
7: <sup>7</sup> Let Israel hope in the LORD: for with the LORD there is mercy, and with him is plenteous redemption.
8: <sup>8</sup> And he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities.
